column4: ok, lets get that in your root profiles
give me a minute to work it out
ok, I have a dirty fix for you
in your /home/$useraname/.bashrc look for the words "alias" you'll see a few commands being aliased, eg: alias ls=`ls --color"
you need to add a line that says "alias sudo=`sudo -E`
restart your shell, and your problems should be done
btw do u remember a guy who used to use the "su" command and messed up his bah environment  and ended up not being able to use wget?? it was me...and u tracked that down :D
